intro: Cordyline macrophylla, commonly known as the cabbage tree or glory of the snow, is a striking evergreen plant native to New Zealand. It features tall, unbranched stems with large, sword-shaped leaves that can grow up to 2 meters in length. The plant produces showy, fragrant inflorescences of white or pink flowers in the spring. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its dramatic appearance and resilience. Its leaves are also used in traditional Māori medicine and cuisine.
